content.description: The route starts off with good foot ledge and a good right hand hold. Once there, make an easy move to a sharp crimp set your feet, and throw to a crimpy knob on the left outside bulge. Your feet will most likely cut, but keep the two holds, and throw a heel to a sharp edge just right and a little up from the right hand crimp. Move right hand to a good pocket, and top it out. The crux for me was the jump!
content.location: Look for the wave feature. The start will be just to the right.

content.description:
Stand start with a right incut sidepull. From there, pop up to a left hand teardrop, then continue straight up using any hold that works to reach an easy mantel.

Since the top is dirty, any rain will wash the dirt onto the problem, so odds are, it will be dirty, bring a brush.
content.protection: A pair pads should be fine. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the left side of the crack on the boulder's north face.

content.description: Start on two obvious pockets, get your feet on, and move left hand to a decent crimp. Do the same with right hand. From here, the problem gets harder. Different beta may work for other people, but I tried multiple ways, and this one worked for me. Move your right hand to a vertical crimp and your left foot up to the right hand starting pocket. Pull hard with your left foot to go left hand to the left vertical crimp. The next move was the crux for me. Pull hard on the crimps, stand up on left foot and get the right foot up. From there, move to the lip. Finish with an easy topout.
content.protection: A couple of pads, I highly recommend placing one over the rock directly behind and having a good spotter.
content.location: It is on the Southeast side of Kraken Block, the narrow side. Use the photo to find the route. Do an easy downclimb on the northwest side of the boulder.
